name: NBN Root Glacier
description: Install a Pup 3rd out and rez it off a Root for a total of zero credits spent? Your install cost for your 4th piece of ice on your empty remote is effectively zero? WHAT CANT ROOT DO? Build that glacier full of cheap tax ice sprinkled with big crap like Booths and cap that bitch of with an RSVP. Bitches love RSVP.

name: The BioProgram v1
description:
The Plan, by Chaos Theory

Sunday, July 27, 20XX

I only truly want up to two Hemorrhages on the field, since trashing up to two HQ cards per turn can cripple the corp (and if they purge to prevent that, woe be to them.) That's 2 MU.

Magnum is there to fuel other cards as an early-mid game bank, taking up 2 MU while it's out (hopefully trashed to Aesop's or with Scavenge to grab a trashed breaker.)

Net Shield is to be used when necessary (a must have against Jinteki), though it can still protect against nasty Snares!. Omni-Drive hosting Net Shield means its a discounted net damage prevention each turn that doesn't affect my MU.

Paricia's simple existence is to help eliminate the all-important Assets that aid the Corp. Particularly effective vs Asset-reliant decks, though it'll often take up an MU, so it can become Aesop fodder once I'm comfortable that Assets have been cleaned up.

Breakers are selected for efficiency and power. I can host either Battering Ram OR Garrote for a nicely pumped breaker (5 STR, 4 STR respectively), selecting whichever would suit me better depending on the corp's ice. Oftentimes it'll be Garrote for Jinteki / Tag'n'bag and Battering Ram for glaciers / Bioroid (pesky barrieroids!). This saves me 2 MU, which is fantastic.

Torch is a stand alone powerhouse, capable of turning any Code Gates into ash with ease. I'll attempt to host it onto Omni-Drive, freeing up an MU and letting me add fuel to Torch every turn.

With all programs out and properly tricked out, I'm using 2 MU from Garrote or Battering Ram, 1 MU per Hemorrhage (up to 3), after I'm done with Paricia and Magnum. In short, this deck should never have MU issues, card order willing.

Test Run / Scavenge is the easiest way to get my Torch and Garrote going (or Battering, depending on the situation), but should they not emerge, I'll have to rely on Kati stockpile and Personal Workshop to get things paid for, though I'd rather save Kati for when my breakers are up and running and I'm ready to smash through everything.

Clone Chips help keep me safe from Program trashing (though most semi-advanced remotes should be run, the most dangerous being Junebug). Borrowed Satellite help ensure my Diesel / QT usage isn't wasted, and mitigates Brain Damage / Trace / Scorched effectiveness.

Aesop's is mainly there to clean up the field once I don't need PW (also eats up additional ones that pop up for 2 credits), get an extra credit for DC, get income tax on Kati once she's done, and even eat up Paricia / unused Clone Chips.

Last but not least, the star of the show. Woman in the Red Dress plays a special role in tandem with Hemorrhage. Let's say the card is an Agenda. Corp keeps it there. They draw that Agenda, and now I know I can attack HQ with a chance at an Agenda. If I have 2 or 4 virus counters, I can use them. Now the Corp must decide; get rid of other valuable cards (ops, assets) or keep the Agenda in hand? If they trash the Agenda, they have to protect Archives, causing them to use more ice. If they don't, they lose another card and still worry about HQ (which normally isn't the case against Shapers). If they draw the Agenda, I know its there, and they're drawing another card, getting them closer to milling, and potentially drawing another Agenda, making HQ a nice target. Paricia plays a nice role in wiping away assets they draw in the process.

This deck aims to threaten all centrals on a more subtle scale, forcing the corp to divide their efforts actively or risk losing Agendas in a flash.

I've played one game so far with a deck similar to this (made modifications after seeing its weaknesses), though I feel this one should do quite well. The biggest enemy (as always) is starting hands, but each card serves a purpose, let's just hope we get at least one econ card in starting (Magnum, Kati, Personal Workshop), for they'll keep us going.

I'll update this as I play matches! Questions, comments and constructive criticisms are welcome.

name: Weyland Fast Glacier v1
description: Step 1. Make lots of money. Step 2. Ice up centrals (specifically HQ). Step 3. Profit.

name: Parasites Lost
description: so experiment time. Feedback appreciated

name: The BioProgram v2
description:
Its as if these cards are telling a story. Perhaps I'll nickname this deck 'Chaos Ark'. The Programs paint a nice picture (until you get to Garrote...) Anyway...

After some great advice, I've included Upstalk in here.

Leprechaun can grab a 2 MU breaker + Magnum, saving me 3 MU.

The remaining 2 MU breaker will go on Dinosaurus.

That leaves 4 MU for Torch, Paricia, Deus X and Hemorrhage. (Once I feel I've trashed enough Assets, I'll hopefully Aesop Paricia for 3 free credits and another Hemorrhage).

Hopefully every card inclusion speaks for itself at this point (if not, check out v1 for my unnecessarily lengthy analysis).

name: NEXT Stop, Haas-Bioroid!
description:
Der Lauf endet hier!

This is a very, very similar build (credit goes) to CodeMarvelous's NEXT Design concept posted recently. I simply pulled out Successful Demonstrations in favor of Blue Levels. There are risks and rewards to doing this, and I'm fully aware of them...but I feel I must try it out and get the feel for things now that Upstalk is finally here.

Please post feedback. :) This is my favorite corp, and I'm very self-insistent on playing this until I get it right!

name: nuke it from orbit 3
description:
Largely unchanged from nuke it from orbit 2.

2X DRT and 1x Melange removed to make way for 3x Snare! to find a way of punishing R&D/HQ locks, and to do damage past plascretes. DRT wasnt doing all that much anyway as runners tend to avoid tags when running against this deck. Snare! played in a server can also serve as a way to protect Jackson/DRT until they are ready to be played - once bitten twice shy as the saying goes

name: nuke it from orbit 4
description:
slight tweaking of nuke it from orbit 3

Primary transmission dish now makes firing SEA Source, that much easier, as well as increasing the draw power of the deck, meaning one anonymous tip could be dropped. I found that by the time I was ready to fire SEA Source I had no difficulty having at least one in hand, so reduced the number in the deck by one.

These changes also add to diversified portfolio, meaning that if drawn at the right time it could net a maximum of 13 credits each, meaning a maximum of 39 credits from 3 cards (though reaching this maximum is very unlikely)

name: Nasir Recuring Free Money
description:
So the main idea is to use recurring cred's to allow Nasir to run with no money obverse enough.

The rabbit holes are in so i can use Trade-In to go looking for all my other hardware that way i can take more hardware and less duplicates.

Compromised helps maximse your ability and helps stop spinal from biting you in the arse.

Personal workshop is obverse here allowing cheaper installs and dumping your cash before an ice res.

Kati for some late game cash flow or recovery from a pop-up window.

Datasuker helps save cash/ stealth cred's when using dagger/switchblade.

Feel free to comment.

name: Sugar Momma
description:
This lazy cougar is dripping in money. She just waits around and magically gets a ton of money. Semi standard Andy deck with some oddballs that work very well. If you have questions or just doubt my cloudy judgement, please post them here and I will attempt to type a reasonable response. Here are answers to frequent questions I get about this deck:

RECORD RECONSTRUCTOR, ARE YOU ON DRUGS?

Maybe, but that's none of your business. However, record reconstructor is a great card to make the corp waste time. If only there were a card where I got money for the corp wasting time. Hello Gorman Drip, you sexy slut.

WHERE'S YOUR PREPAID?

I'd rather just get the money upfront, rather than having to play an event and possibly saving money. With her one link, initial draw of 9 cards, and three Dysons, it is very easy to get to two link and start reeling in the dough after that with underworld.

WHERE'S YOUR PLASCRETE?

Son, this sugar momma has too much cheddar to get PC'd or Sea Scorched. It has been a very rare occasion, but it can still happen.

WHERE'S YOUR PARASITES?

Emergency Shutdown & compromised employee. Why would I want to destroy the ice that I get money from?

ZU VS GORDIAN ?

I am already getting the link and would rather save my memory for permanent sneakdoor and extra drips / deus / faerie. I also wanted that 1 extra OOF for Levy AR.

DEUS X ?

Couple of situations here. Was getting tired of being philotic'd from Jinteki late in the game. Also a great way to get through AP ice and then emergency shutdown. Deus X helped me quite a bit at regionals, so it is sticking around.

name: Meat, Money, Murder
description:
Questions about dedicated response team:

1: Can I rez them when the runner is about to access another server?

2: If I had two out would they both fire, doing four meat damage when the run ends?

name: Chaos Theory Keyhole Medium v1
description: ideally lockdown R&D with Keyhole, get Medium installed when possible to rack up tokens, give Corp a bad time. Alias to make sure I can get in, get data sucker tokens to help Atman.

name: Out of shape
description: 3 now

name: Aesop's Wyldside
Bike Shop
description:
If there was a unifying card to this deck, it would be Scavenge. It's a card that I adore, and even when the deck-science suggests that taking 3 shouldn't be overboard, in practice I would almost always find it wasting away in my hand. This deck runs Cy-cy's, Atman, ad Femme, so there should generally be a program that benefits from being reset, even if you're not using scavenge to save a program or test run/scavenge.

Public Sympathy is a card I like to run with stimhacks, but you could totally go for more plascretes instead. Most of the hardware you want ticking down on personal workshop between programs, but sometimes you might want to play it straight from the grip.

you should be able to coast on cyber-cyphers with a femme or an atman well into mid game, where you might need to worry about getting your morningstar or another femme out. You only really need to play torch if there are a lot of code gates, otherwise 3 cyber-cyphers probably covers it.

name: NBN Scorched
description: 1st test with NBN deck

name: Kit Codebreaking
Chaotic Motivation
Digital Tinkerer 1.0
description: By in large the same Kate deck I have been playing, swithced out a scavange for a clone-chip and found a way to add in deus x

name: Not so Glacial HB
Spinal Modem = Nintendo Power Glove
description:
Essentially this is an Anarch deck that plays a little like a Shaper deck - set up very efficient Anarch icebreakers + an economy rig and then start breaking through almost anything for very cheap.

EVENTS - Express Delivery is a decent draw tool in this deck because of all the multiple copies (and only 1 influence). All the other events are economy.

HARDWARE - Obligatory Plascretes to avoid Scorched BS, and a lot of economy hardware ie. recurring credits to use on icebreakers. Personal Touch is a big deal when using only fixed strength breakers.

RESOURCE - Kati is great because of the way the deck plays (when you can't get in anymore, you spend 5-6 turns just drawing and clicking like crazy to get the cards/money you need). ProCon works into this plan well as well, and Ice Carver again is great with fixed strength breakers.

ICEBREAKERS - All the fixed strength Anarch breakers. Costly to set up, but very efficient. The deck relies entirely of drawing at least one copy of these.

PROGRAMS - All ice debuff programs. Parasite is very useful early game (especially combined with Ice Carver and Datasuckers).

The main issues are: - Big traces on runs (or traces on upgrades like Ash) causing brain damage - this is mostly a problem since once the rig is set up you will not have that much money to beat these traces. Note that Spinal Modem will ONLY give you brain damage on trace DURING A RUN, not any trace. - Big ICE that will be difficult to reduce to breakable range. - And most importantly, not drawing the cards you need when you draw (that Anarch RNG).

Originally the deck was with Reina, but the Whizzard ability serves to keep the Corp poorer early on (don't want to put down unprotected assets) as well as allowing me to be more aggressive (trashing R&D cards early). Also trashing Jacksons for nothing makes you feel warm and fuzzy.

Drawing is kind of a problem in Anarchs, but I find between Professional Contacts, Express Delivery and a little luck, I can get what I want reasonably quickly - the issue is then getting the money up over 3-4 turns (usually Katie) to do with before the corp just wins. If I get set up quickly and the Corp doesn't have any big ICE, then I usually end up running 3-4 times a turn for basically nothing.

A good opening hand will have 2-3 economy cards (Sure Gamble/Kati/ProCon/Modded) and a Datasucker/Parasite.

The deck is slightly limited as I am missing 4 datapacks from Genesis, but it has done well for me regardless. In the future I would probably look at putting in Duggars instead of Express Delivery and Professional Contacts, leaving more influence for strong economy cards and another Personal Touch.

name: Brian
description: Brain damage vs Agenda points creeps out runners if you mushin 3x counters, then advance again. With EtF, it's free, making this a fairly rich corp. GRNDL makes the money, especially with an early mandatory upgrades score.

name: Doucheteki / Personal Evolution
description:
Nothing really groundbreaking here - just a Personal Evolution deck improved by Honor and Profit cards (specifically agendas and Psychic Field). Not a flatline deck as much as being annoying and making runners sweat. It also requires you to be pretty good at bluffing and generally doing irrational YOLO-type plays.

The primary mode of winning for this deck is advancing agendas put down the previous turn. Alternatively a runner could flatline himself early on by facechecking ICE and running into a snare/shock/agenda.

The strength of the deck is information control. The runner won't want to be running on low cards because of the identity ability, Snares and Shocks... but they also don't want to hit a Psychic Field with 5+ cards in their hand either. Sweet sweet douchery.

AGENDAS - Most of the agendas in here are 1 or 2pt agendas, as this maxes the benefit of the ID. The only 4/2 agenda is Medical Breakthrough, as it reduces its cost when scored (thus I don't mind so much when it is stolen early) and you can fast advance the last one. Gila Hands Archology is also decent economy, which the deck needs quite a lot. I have won a few games by scoring a Philotic Entanglement against a runner with 5 agendas in his pool. You can't rely on it in any way, but is super douchy/rewarding when it happens.

ASSETS - Most of the assets are non-advanceable traps (Psych Field, Shock, Snare) with 2 non-trap assets: Isabel McGuire (used to return failed traps to hand, forcing people to spend money to trash shocks and Psychic Fields) and Zaibatsu Loyalty (to help against expose effects). Both have respectable thrash costs so I don't mind losing them too much.

ICE - Most of the ICE is quite porous and is really only useful early game to deal as much damage as possible in that timeframe (Archer is the exception). Ideally you want a Komainu on HQ and R&D, and the other ICE can go anywhere depending on your opponent - it is rare to go deep on any server. You can switch the ICE around at will, but essentially you want Komainus and Data Mines, a few big "surprise" damaging ICE like Archer or Janus 1.0, and then some cheap taxing ICE.

OPERATIONS - Most operations are low-level money cards since most times the deck is pretty low on money from advancing and paying for traps. Shipments from Mirrormorph give good click economy if they show up (usually use them to install an agenda and 2 traps). I thought about Celebrity Gift for a while, but given the deck's reliance on obscuring information, I found I didn't want to expose my hand most of the time.

The best opening hand is one or two pieces of ICE (preferably a Komainu/Katana), a trap or two, an agenda and an operation of some form.

Good counters against it include Net Shield or Feedback Filter + heaps of cash generation, Levy AR, Deus Ex + Clone Chips, or tons of expose. It is a really fun deck to play if you're into being a total douche and making your opponent suffer, although it gets shut down pretty hard by a few cards which prevent net damage and deck attrition.

Changes would probably revolve around modifying the ICE around a bit to suit your preferences, and possibly changing the agenda composition a bit. I have considered an alternate, slightly douchier slant on this deck that runs Profiteering and generates tons of bad pub and money in the mid game to rez surprise monster ICE (ie.Susanoo, Janus,) that cost lots to break + another Snare.

name: Child's Play
description:
Overmind is the primary breaker for this set up. Chaos Theory: Wünderkind's +1 MU will help make this more tenable. Rabbit Hole and Borrowed Satellite will give a boost to link, making Creeper and ZU.13 Key Master take up no MUs. They also help keep those counters around longer if needed (and deal with Swordsman). Scavenge and Clone Chip will allow us to refresh Overmind. Use Personal Workshop to hold onto programs until they are needed to keep the MUs high, and it's a nice by-product that the program's will be at reduced cost. Self-modifying Code will also allow us to dig for the right program at the right time, and keep the total quantity of programs down.

For economy, Account Siphon and Stimhack, will provide boosts, and Desperado and Underworld Contact will give a steady income stream. Magnum Opus will give a long-term credit supply. Personal Workshop should also help keep costs down.

name: Kit Peddler, Monomaniacal Cryptographer (v0.9)
description: When all you have is a hammer, everything looks like a nail. Fortunately, Kit has an impressive collection of hammers.

name: Transcendence
description:
When you're jacked in, where does the man end and the code begin?

Nasir is an amazingly fun runner due to abuse of his identity ability and the timing windows of a run. Mastery of this coupled with shaper ability to tutor exactly the answer they need on demand makes him a huge force to be reckoned with.

Whats seemingly a standard of Nasir decks are their usage of personal workshops as a way to dump economy in a useful way after the corp rezzes an approached ice. This strategy hastens the building of an expensive rig very quickly as now runs on an entirely unrezzed server are generating useful economy in addition to gathering information and costing the corp. Often Ill run with 0 credits on an unrezzed server to provoke the rez and earn economy or gain a free card access.

What's unique to this build is the focus on link paired with underworld contacts as a drip economy making sure that you always starts his turn with enough to trigger a quality time or even threaten the corp on click one. This frees you from having to click for economy and allows you more focus on setting up your workshops and making runs. Daily casts is also wonderful here as a way in the early game to get rid of your 3 credits before a run on an unrezzed server and make certain your economy doesnt suffer from a poorly timed facecheck of a popup window.

I've also chosen to forego plascretes in favor of high link and imp which can trash key punishing cards such as scorched earth and midseasons. Imp can then be recurred on demand by clone chips and scavenges. As for ice that's abit too pricey to break frequently, there are femmes with enough recursion and scavenges to make certain they go where you want them to be when you need it. Parasites handle pesky cheap ice, sometimes before you even have to trigger the encounter, a great way to handle popup windows and rototurrets. If you've just cashed in your kati and a ice wall is about to make you lose all your economy, a femme can save your economy by bypassing the ice instead of encounter and then scavenges can put the femme in a more useful position again.

Other tweaks & variants

I originally was testing out spinal modem as a way to speed up the aggression of the deck more, they work fantastically but I'm now at the step where I'm testing toolbox instead while I use that influence on the hostages to ensure I get my kati jones and drip economy setup earlier than later. I'm very tempted to also put in a single professional contacts if I stick with the hostages and toolboxes as a way to also generate further economy to speed up the play of the femmes and toolbox.

name: Pillow Fort II
Exposed Engineering
Nasty Nas
